facts: Seller agreed to deliver goods on June 1
On May 1, seller notified buyer: 'I will not deliver the goods'
Statement was clear and definite refusal
asp_facts: contract(c1). parties(c1, seller, buyer). subject_matter(c1, goods). anticipatory_repudiation(c1, yes). repudiation_clear(c1, yes). repudiation_unequivocal(c1, yes). performance_due(c1, no). retraction(c1, no). buyer_action(c1, may_treat_as_breach). immediate_remedy(c1, yes).
question: Can buyer immediately sue for breach?
rationale: An anticipatory repudiation occurs when a party clearly and unequivocally indicates they will not perform. The non-repudiating party may treat this as an immediate breach and sue for damages without waiting for the performance date.
